alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 12 at 6:25PM MST until December 12 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 625 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Village At Oak Creek, or 10 miles southeast of Sedona, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility to less than a mile . Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 299 and 315. State Route 179 between mile markers 304 and 305. This snow squall will remain over mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
